safety_edibility_notes: Protected under the Bald and Golden Eagle Protection Act. Killing, capturing, or possessing bald eagles is a federal crime in the USA with fines up to $100,000.
safety_warning_text: Bald eagles may attack if nests are approached. Talons can cause serious lacerations. Generally avoid humans. Dive attacks are rare but possible during nesting season.
safety_summary: Bald eagles pose minimal threat to humans unless nests are approached. Maintain distance from nesting sites, especially during breeding season. Eagles may become aggressive defending territory.
safety_contraindications: Maintain buffer zones during nesting (typically 330-660 feet)
Do not harass or pursue eagles
Report injured eagles to wildlife authorities
encounter_protocol: Observe from distance. If dive-bombed near nest, leave area calmly. Do not run or flail arms. Shield head if attacked.
legal_protection_status: Bald and Golden Eagle Protection Act, MBTA, recovered from endangered status 2007
